availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Emmet Harris (Madison County, KY, farm laborer)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of John M. Harris and Sally A. Harris. Farm laborer in Madison County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farm laborer in Madison County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County,District 1, p. 208A
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County,Richmond, p. 2
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision No. 2, p. 253
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County,Richmond, p. 475 (p. 5 of microfilm).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 251B
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183302 , p. 273 of microfilm
Find A Grave, "Robert Emmet Harris (1840-1900)," Memorial #59760909, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59760909/robert-emmet-harris, (accessed October 14, 2019).
